item.name: ESXi memory available
item.description: Amount of memory available to run Virutal Machines and to allocate for hypervisor needs. It is computed by subtracting vmwMemCOS from vmwMemSize. The result is the amount of memory available to VMs and to the hypervisor. To get a more accurate view of memory available to VMs the following property represents the amount of resources available for the root resource pool for running virtual machines. VIM property: effectiveMemory MOB: https://esx.example.com/mob/?moid=ha%2dcompute%2dres&doPath=summary

item.name: ESXi memory size
item.description: Amount of physical memory present on machine as provided by Hypervisor. It is computed from the sum of vmwMemCOS plus unreserved property as reported VIM subsystem. Unreserved is computed from hypervisor's total number of memory pages. VIM Parent Container: https://esx.example.com/mob/?moid=memorySystem VIM property: unreserved MOB: https://esx.example.com/mob/?moid=memoryManagerSystem&doPath=consoleReservationInfo For reference here two other related VIM properties: VIM property: memorySize MOB: https://esx.example.com/mob/?moid=ha%2dhost&doPath=summary%2ehardware VIM property: totalMemory MOB: https://esx.example.com/mob/?moid=ha%2dcompute%2dres&doPath=summary

trigger.name: Available memory on {HOST.NAME} in too low

item.name: ESXi physical CPU numbers
item.description: Number of physical CPUs on the system.

item.name: ESXi Build
item.description: This identifier represents the most specific identifier. VIM Property: AboutInfo.build https://esx.example.com/mob/?moid=ServiceInstance&doPath=content%2eabout

item.name: ESXi name
item.description: This product's name. VIM Property: AboutInfo.name https://esx.example.com/mob/?moid=ServiceInstance&doPath=content%2eabout

item.name: ESXi Version
item.description: The product's version release identifier. Format is Major.Minor.Update VIM Property: AboutInfo.version https://esx.example.com/mob/?moid=ServiceInstance&doPath=content%2eabout

discovery_rule.name: Environment discovery
discovery_rule.description: A unique identifier that does not persist across management restarts

item_prototype.name: ESXi subsystem {#SNMPINDEX} description
item_prototype.description: Human readable description of this event

item_prototype.name: ESXi subsystem {#SNMPINDEX} status
item_prototype.description: Last reported state of this component

trigger_prototype.name: ESXi subsystem {#SNMPINDEX} on {HOST.NAME} status is not OK

discovery_rule.name: Virtual Machines
discovery_rule.description: Name by which this vm is displayed. It is not guaranteed to be unique. MOB: https://esx.example.com/mob/?moid=vmwVmIdx&doPath=summary%2eguest

item_prototype.name: VM {#SNMPVALUE} CPUs Number
item_prototype.description: Number of virtual CPUs assigned to this virtual machine. VIM Property: numCPU MOB: https://esx.example.com/mob/?moid=vmwVmIdx&doPath=config%2ehardware

item_prototype.name: VM {#SNMPVALUE} Guest OS
item_prototype.description: Operating system running on this vm. This value corresponds to the value specified when creating the VM and unless set correctly may differ from the actual OS running. Will return one of the values if set in order: Vim.Vm.GuestInfo.guestFullName Vim.Vm.GuestInfo.guestId Vim.Vm.GuestInfo.guestFamily MOB: https://esx.example.com/mob/?moid=vmwVmIdx&doPath=guest where moid = vmwVmIdx. If VMware Tools is not running, value will be of form 'E: error message'

item_prototype.name: VM {#SNMPVALUE} Guest State
item_prototype.description: Operation mode of guest operating system. Values include: running - Guest is running normally. shuttingdown - Guest has a pending shutdown command. resetting - Guest has a pending reset command. standby - Guest has a pending standby command. notrunning - Guest is not running. unknown - Guest information is not available. VIM Property: guestState MOB: https://esx.example.com/mob/?moid=vmwVmIdx&doPath=guest

item_prototype.name: VM {#SNMPVALUE} Memory Size
item_prototype.description: Memory configured for this virtual machine. Memory > MAX Integer32 is reported as max integer32. VIM Property: memoryMB MOB: https://esx.example.com/mob/?moid=vmwVmIdx&doPath=config%2ehardware

item_prototype.name: VM {#SNMPVALUE} Power State
item_prototype.description: Power state of the virtual machine. VIM Property: powerState MOB: https://esx.example.com/mob/?moid=vmwVmIdx&doPath=summary%2eruntime
